fields.description:
h5. Facts

# The "Anonymous Access to Remote API" checkbox button is for SOAP/XML-RPC and not for REST API
!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
# There is no equivalent control of REST API in Confluence

h5. Expectation

Be able to restrict anonymous Remote API access to confluence even though Confluence has "Anonymous Access" enabled on UI side

h5. Sample use case:
If users would like to have spaces with anonymous access via theUI, but we want to keep the API restricted. 
For example, if users has a reverse proxy in front of their Confluence installation which implements certain security checks, and they do not want people to be able to access content without having first passed through this layer. The security checks rely on a browser, so they cannot easily pass requests to the REST API through it.
fields.summary: Be able to restrict anonymous REST API connection when Confluence has Anonymous Access

fields.description: PostgreSQL 10 is under development now by PostgreSQL.org committers. We should begin to review same for Confluence Enterprise clients as well. This new version will *require* the new PostgeSQL 42.1.1 JDBC driver as well. As we are agile with other parts of our application, we should be so with our backend as clients will want to run the newer versions to keep up with development and features.
fields.summary: Support for PostgreSQL 10

fields.description:
h3. Summary
@ mention and // don't work with macOS Japanese Input Method on Safari.

||browser|| Japanese Input Method||@||//||
|Safari | macOS Japanese Input method|(x)|(x)|
|Safari | google Japanese Input method|(/)|(/)|

h3. Environment
* macOS + Safari + macOS Japanese Input method
* 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable macOS default Japanese Input method in macOS System Preference
https://support.apple.com/kb/PH22653?locale=en_US
# Edit a page in Confluence
# Input @ or //, it does not work.

h3. Expected Results
Performing @ works as a mention.
Performing // works as a date.

h3. Actual Results
@ and // do NOT work as a mention or date.

h3.Workaround
Use Google Japanese Input method on Safari.
or 
Use Chrome browser
fields.summary: @ mention and // don't work with macOS Japanese Input Method on Safari

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
For restricted spaces:
# Create a question and add some answers
# Search for the question title
#- Observe that you see the question and the answers in the search results
# Move the question to a restricted space and log in with a user who cannot see that space
# Search again
#- Observe that you see the answers, but not the question, in the search results

For archived spaces:
# Create a question in a space and add some answers
# Search for the question title
#- Observe that you see the question and the answers in the search results
# Archive the space
# Search again
#- Observe that you see the answers, but not the question, in the search results
fields.summary: Answers to Confluence Questions that are moved to a restricted or archived space still show in the index

fields.description:
Hello Team, 

Could not find another bug related to this issue so I'll be creating this bug. 

h5.Steps to Replicate
# Create a blog post with more than one image.
# Create another blog post with more than one image
# Go to the *Blog* Icon on the Sidebar to see All the newest blog posts
# Click on any image to preview

h5.Expected behavior
You should be able to click on an image and the preview starts on the *clicked image*

h5.Actual results
You can start the preview on the image you've clicked, but the next time you try to preview *any* image, the preview starts all the way on the latest blog post.

Here's a video for visual reasons... 
[^blogposts.mp4]  

Kind regards,
Marco Aurélio Bomfim | Atlassian Support Engineer
fields.summary: Blog Posts Image Preview not Working Properly

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When SD customer try to access the KB article from Mobile browser, Confluence will ask customer to login in order to view the page (Anonymous access is not enabled for the relevant space).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup a Confluence space (remove anonymous access for the space).
# Setup a JIRA Service Desk project and link to the Confluence space. Make sure to set *All active users and customers can access the knowledge base without a Confluence license.* in SD project settings.
# Try to access the customer portal from mobile browser.
# Search for KB articles in SD portal.
# Verify that the result list get displayed correctly and click on one KB link.
# You will get a login button in an iframe ask you to login to Confluence to see the page.
# Click on the login button, a new tab is opened with login form for Confluence.
# Try to login as SD *customer*. (user without having a Confluence license)


h3. Expected Results
After login, the KB article get displayed correctly.

h3. Actual Results
After login, 403 error is thrown as below :
 !2017-06-27_mobile-403.png|thumbnail! 


h3.Workaround
Despite the fact that a 403 error is thrown, the user has successfully logged in, therefore an active session is created. User can close current tab and go back to the previous tab (in JSD portal) and refresh the page.
fields.summary: A 403 error is thrown when SD customer try to login to Confluence to view KB

fields.description:
Documentation for Confluence 6and [XML backup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/manually-backing-up-the-site-152405.html]  should include information about unpublished drafts as stated in [Administering collaborative editing|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/administering-collaborative-editing-858772086.html#AdministeringCollaborativeEditing-Unpublisheddraftsarenotincludedinspaceorsiteexports].

Without this, users will know know that they will lose unpublished changes during the backup restore procedure.
fields.summary: Backup documentation should include information about unpublished drafts.

fields.description: We use Confluence to maintain specifications.  The specifications are long, complicated and change often, the changes are driven by JIRA.  It is important to know when a part of a document has changed because of a specific issue and to be able to match changes with issues in the document history.  However, users make mistakes in the change comments or forget to fill them.  We would like to be able to modify a missing or wrong change information after the page has been modified.
fields.summary: Ability to edit page and attachment version change comments

fields.description:
I am working on updating an internal page within the company I am working for. I have a big table in Excel with some columns with a default width. See the first screenshot. 

 

So, in excel I have the following table as conf2.png shows.

We see that in the first row, when the Age is filled in (and Some info as well), the first column is resized to the correct width. However, take a look at the third row. I only filled in the first column with a very long name.

When I select the four rows (first row is the header row, other three are the content rows) and then paste it into a Confluence page, the following parsed table appears: conf1.png 

Here, Confluence automatically merges the three cells. 

Is this normal behaviour and is my mindset incorrect? As I would expect to have no merged cells, but just a longer Title column. Because when I resize the columns in Excel, then copy and paste, there are no cells being merged.

I am using: Microsoft Office 365 Business version 1706 (build 8229.2045) and Confluence 6.2.3
fields.summary: Pasting table from Excel combines some cells

fields.description: As a company we maintain a calendar in confluence to track birthdays, vacations and other personal events.  I have additional spaces for each of our client projects which has a calendar that pertains to that client.  However, I would like to embed a portion of our company calendar that involves the people working on that project only.  For instance, I want to see the vacation scheduled for the people on the team for that space only.  Is that possible?
fields.summary: Querying an embedded calendar

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a user leaves a pinned comment in an attachment, one entry will be added in the activity stream. If someone uploads a newer version of the attachment to the same page, that entry will be broken. Clicking on the link will lead the user to a greyed page, as if the preview was not being properly loaded.

h3. Steps to reproduce
1. Attach a PDF file to a page.
2. Preview the file and leave a pinned comment on it.
3. Attach another PDF file with the same name, so that Confluence considers "Version 2".
4. Go to the Dashboard or any page with an Activity Stream macro.
5. Click the link referring to the pinned comment from step 2.
h3. Expected Results

Confluence should preview the older file and highlight the pinned comment.

h3. Actual Results
The opaque grey screen from the file preview window appears, but no file is shown.

!Screen Shot 2017-06-26 at 10.26.21 AM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Activity stream link to a pinned comment on older attachment version will lead to a greyed page

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Unlinking some types of valid URLs cause the URL to be encoded again and become invalid.  
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Paste a URL with a character from [this list|https://html.spec.watwg.org/multipage/named-characters.html]. Example: [http://www.example.org/?foo=bar&gtin=4049999990004].
 # Save the page.
 # Edit the page and unlink the URL.

h3. Expected Results
 * The URL is not modified after unlinking and remains a valid URL.

h3. Actual Results
 * The URL is encoded in the source as [http://www.example.org/?foo=bar&gtin=4049999990004|http://www.example.org/?foo=bar&gtin=4049999990004], so that it ends up being doubly encoded after unlinking.  The link [http://www.example.org/?foo=bar&gtin=4049999990004] turns into [http://www.example.org/?foo=bar]>in=4049999990004 on the page.

h3. Workaround

There is no workaround at this time.
fields.summary: Valid HTTP URLs are broken by the link macro when unlinked

fields.description:
Hey all,

my colleagues are complaining because their Confluence comments can be edited by every user with the "Add Comments" permission in a space. Worst thing about that: It is not visible in the comment that is has been edited by another user.

Could you please improve that behavior, for example: The "Add Comments" permission should only allow users to edit their own comments, editing other comments might be included in the "Delete comments" or even in the administrators role.

Is this possible or is there maybe another solution for that?

Cheers,
Jan
fields.summary: Edit Comments Permission in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Thumbnails show a broken image when their source page has restrictions.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * User1 creates Page1 and uploads an image.
 * User1 adds restrictions to this page, so only User1 can view and edit the page.
 * User1 creates Page2 with no restrictions and adds the image (Insert Files and Images > Search on Other Pages > Add Image from step 1)
 * User2 logs in and views Page2.

h3. Expected Results
 * The thumbnail is visible to User2

h3. Actual Results
 * The thumbnail is not visible and a broken image icon is displayed instead.  However when clicking on the thumbnail, the file or image is still displayed as normal.

h3.Workaround

No workaround at this time.
fields.summary: Thumbnails show broken image when source page has restrictions, though you can view the file

fields.description:
Oracle 12c Release 2 is now available [https://docs.oracle.com/database/122/]
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - July 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Thanks for your interest in this issue.

Traditionally we have not needed to do any specific testing to be able to support an 'R2' of a database. It appears that Oracle have made significant changes in 12c R2 requiring us to be judicious in updating our automated testing.

Oracle 12c R2 support is ready to go with the upcoming release of of Confluence 6.11. Check out [Preparing for Confluence 6.11|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/preparing-for-confluence-6-11-952616942.html] for what else is in the pipeline.

Cheers,

Adam - Confluence Product Management
{panel}
fields.summary: Add support for Oracle 12c release 2

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If you create a page using the section macro with two columns, and the left most column is made up of only images, some browsers will cause the left column of images to disappear when zooming in.

 

h3. Environment
Occurs in Confluence 5.9, 5.10, 6.1, 6.2. I am not able to reproduce in a beta of 6.3.

In Windows, occurs in Firefox, Chrome, and Edge. Does not occur in IE.

In Mac OS X, issue occurs in Chrome, Safari, but not Firefox.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page using the attached storage format, along with the attached image.
 # Zoom in and observe that the left most column of images will disappear
 # If you add some text to the left most column, the issue no longer occurs. The left most column must be only images for the issue to occur.

h3. Expected Results

Left most column should not disappear when zooming in.

h3. Actual Results
The left most column disappears in some browsers when zooming in
 
h3.Solution / Workaround
Add some text in the left most column and the issue will not occur.
fields.summary: Column can disappear when page is zoomed in the browser

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Notifications are no longer sent when a page is moved to the trash or when trash is purged.  This occurs even though the page-trashed-notification module in the Confluence Content Notifications add-on is enabled.  In the past this is what could be disabled in order to cease these notifications.  
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # User 1 creates a new page 
 # User 2 deletes the page
 # No notification is sent out

h3. Expected Results

A notification should be sent out (and has, at least up until 5.8.8).  
h3.  
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround at this time.
fields.summary: No notifications are sent when a page is moved to trash or when trash is purged

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of Oct 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
We've just shipped the next iteration of this feature in v7.14 - you can find the [release notes here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/confluence-7-14-release-notes-1063176411.html].

This extends our earlier support for Rolling Upgrades on bugfix versions that shipped in [v7.9 late last year|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/confluence-7-9-release-notes-1026537698.html].

Upgrading using Rolling Upgrades now allows zero downtime upgrades from one minor version and the next (e.g. 7.14.x -> 7.15.x).
 This is slightly different to Jira, which supports upgrades from one minor version to any other minor version on the same major version, but we've landed this balance to ensure development velocity, while unlocking the ability for customers to truly avoid downtime while upgrading across minor version - even scripting multiple upgrades back to back across multiple minor versions.

We're closing this feature request now, but feel free to reach out with further feedback
{panel}
*Original Description:*
 Currently it is not possible to upgrade Confluence Data Center with zero downtime, as the cluster never allows nodes with mixed versions.

If upgrade tasks between versions allow it, it should be possible to upgrade Confluence Data Center one node at a time, so that there is little or no loss of availability during the upgrade process.

Create feature, similar to JIRA ([Upgrading Jira Data Center with zero downtime|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/upgrading-jira-data-center-with-zero-downtime-938846953.html]), that would support zero downtime for upgrades to Confluence Data Centers.
fields.summary: Zero downtime upgrades for Confluence Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After upgrading from Confluence 5.9.x to 5.10.x, certain PPTX files do not render properly, though they displayed properly prior to the upgrade.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Upload this PPTX file to a Confluence 5.9.x instance:  [^SamplePPTX.pptx] 
# View the PPTX successfully without rendering issues
# Install Confluence 5.10.x or upgrade to 5.10.x
# View the same PPTX file that had worked in Confluence 5.9.x

h3. Expected Results
The PPTX file renders the same way, without issue

h3. Actual Results
The PPTX file does not render correctly - some items are overlapped completely or whole sections of slides are missing.

h3. Notes
The results seem related to the network somehow. In testing, we had an instance with the sample pptx that loaded for all users in one office, but not another.

This could be related to the Confluence preview version or the version of the *file-viewer* library being used.

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround at this time
fields.summary: PowerPoint files don't display properly after upgrading from 5.9.x up to 5.10.x+

The header pops out everything below the first macro and removes all subsequent cells.

 !First View mode.png|thumbnail!  !Editing.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Remove the headers before saving to avoid loosing the table formatting.

- If the page is already affected, copy the page storage format in view mode, then use Source Editor to paste it in edit mode; or

Notes:

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Adding a Vimeo video URL to a Confluence page creates an Flash embed of the video with the Widget Connector. The video won't play on Mac (tested Chrome and Firefox) but works on PC.  The preview placeholder displays, but clicking the Play button the video just appears as though it's still loading, but doesnt play.

YouTube videos added the same way play fine.

I can recreate this in Confluence 6.2.1 with the latest Widget Connector version 3.0.3. 

h3. Environment
* Chrome and Firefox on Mac (PC works)
* Widget Connector - 3.0.3 (latest)
* Confluence - 6.2.3 (latest)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Paste the URL to a Video vimeo on a Confluence page.
# View the page in Mac/Chrome and try to play the video (doesn't work)
# View the page in PC/Chrome and play the video (doesn't work)

h3. Expected Results
Play embedded Vimeo video

h3. Actual Results
The placeholder loads with an image holder for the video. When we click the play button, the video doesn't play. 
 

h3.Workaround
There's isn't a workaround, but alternatives could be:
* Share the URL along with the embedded video so that Mac user's can view the video on the Vimeo website directly
* Host the video on YouTube, which currently plays fine using the Widget Connector
* Embed the video using the *HTML Macro*.  (Requires Confluence Admin to enable the macro, as it's disabled by default for potential security concerns)

Alternative: Enable HTML macro, and use the Vimeo iframe HTML content to add to a Confluence page*
# First enable the HTML macro in Confluence to allow embedding of HTML code (disabled by default).  
## Confluence Administration > Manage Add-Ons
## Change the drop-down filter to *All add-ons*
## Search for *Confluence HTML Macros*
## expand the *Confluence HTML Macros* and click the *+* symbol to show all modules.
## click to *enable* the one for *html* / (html-xhtml).
# Then you can go to your Confluence page and insert a Macro titled *HTML*
# Here you can paste in the "iframe" embed HTML you would get if you go to a video on Vimeo, and click *Share > Embed*.
fields.summary: Vimeo videos embedded with Widget Connector don't play on Mac

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
It's not possible to deploy an Internal Facing Confluence DC on AWS using the quick start CloudFormation template when using own DNS Server.

This happens because the template uses the DNS to mount the EFS into the new Confluence Node, so the two conditions on EC2 to use the EFS via DNS are:
# The connecting EC2 instance must be inside a VPC and must be configured to use the DNS server provided by Amazon. For information about Amazon DNS server, see DHCP Options Sets in the Amazon VPC User Guide.
# The VPC of the connecting EC2 instance must have DNS host names enabled. For more information, see Viewing DNS Hostnames for Your EC2 Instance in the Amazon VPC User Guide.

h3. Suggested Solution
Make it possible to deploy Confluence DC using our own DNS Server.

h3. Why this is important
Currently we can only deploy internet-facing datacenters, but most of the companies need to deploy dev/staging instances too, that should be accessed internally only due to security policies.
 
h3. Workaround 
Currently the only workaround is to use the AWS DNS server instead.
fields.summary: AWS Confluence DC CloudFormation Template: could be able to resolve EFS not only via DNS but also IP

h3. Symptoms

After upgrade to 6.2.2, some profile pictures are strange colours. This issue only affects jpgs that were uploaded around 2+ years ago, when avatars were stored with their filenames in the attachment table rather than simply 'user-avatar'.

Images that are ok are served as src="/download/attachments/425988/user-avatar"
 The ones in negative are served as src="/download/attachments/8782333/\{file-name}.jpg"

Inverse colours:
 !image-2017-06-19-10-55-01-517.png!

Correct colours:
 !image-2017-06-19-10-55-27-024.png!

If you append {{?effects=blur}} to the end of the URL you get the correct colours back, therefore this appears to be related to the image rotation work done in 6.2.2.
h3. Workarounds
 # Go to {{<your-confluence-url>/admin/darkfeatures.action}} and add {{imageFilter.exif.rotate.disabled}}. This will disable the image rotation work done for -CONFSERVER-32762-, but it will resolve this display issue. Be sure to remove it once this issue is resolved.
 # Individual users can upload a new profile picture (jpg, gif or png will all work)

h3. Resolution
If you upgraded to 6.2.2 and are experiencing this issue, you need to perform an additional step to resolve it:
# Upgrade to 6.2.3
# For Confluence Server:
#- Delete the contents of {{<confluence-home>/imgEffects}}
# For Confluence Data Center:
#- Delete the contents of {{<confluence-shared-home>/imgEffects}}

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When importing a word document and splitting by headers, the page tree that gets created is alphabetized. What we are expecting to happen is that the page tree would be in the same order in which the headers appear in the document.

To reproduce, simply import a word document which can be split by multiple headers that do not appear in alphabetical order within the document. Once the document is imported, notice that the page tree is alphabetical in order as opposed to their order within the document.

I have attached an example Word document to test with.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Import  [^Brian.docx] to Confluence and use Split by heading functionality.
# Observe pages tree generated in sidebar.

h3. Expected Results
# Page tree will be ordered properly (as in document).

h3. Actual Results
# Pages are sorted alphabetically.
#  !tree.png|thumbnail! 

 
h3. Notes
The issue is not reproducible with 5.10.8. 
It looks like problem is introduced in Confluence version 6.0.6 and plugin OfficeConnector-5.0.3.jar. The issue is not present in plugin 5.0.2 and Confluence 6.0.5.

h3.Workaround
There are 2 workaround at this point:
# Manually sort and [reorder pages|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/move-and-reorder-pages-146407727.html].
# Downgrade the plugin:
#- Stop confluence
#- Find the folder <confluence-install>/confluence/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins/ on production
#- Backup and move {{OfficeConnector-5.x.x.jar}} from this folder
#- Download [Confluence 5.10.8 zip|https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/downloads/binary/atlassian-confluence-5.10.8.zip].
#- Extract from the same folder OfficeConnector-5.0.2.jar. and copy it to the same folder on production.
#- Remove the following folders:
#-- <confluence-home>/bundled-plugins
#-- <confluence-home>/plugins-cache
#-- <confluence-home>/plugins-osgi-cache
#-- <confluence-home>/plugins-temp
#-- <confluence-home>/bundled-plugins_language
#- Start Confluence

*Note:* The work around (2) has been confirmed to work up up to Confluence 6.5.2 but does not work for Confluence 6.7.1 (Confluence 6.7.1 will crash when importing Word Documents when using the older {{OfficeConnector-5.0.2.jar}})
fields.summary: When importing a word document, header order is not respected

fields.description:
h2. Use case
There are times when it is useful for administrators to get a number of active users that are taking up license seats in Confluence. This feature exists in *Confluence Admin > Licensing Details* for non-Unlimited license tiers, but is not calculated for the Unlimited tier.

Organizations may need this information if they are evaluating moving to a non-Unlimited license tier, or for general auditing purposes.

h2. Existing solutions and their limitations
In the UI, *Confluence Admin > System Information* will show a count of users. However this is simply a sum of all users stored in the {{cwd_user}} table of the database, and does not take in account of which users are marked as Active or check whether they belong in a Global Permissions group. The actual subset of active users counting towards the license can be much smaller.

There is also a [popular KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-get-a-list-of-active-users-counting-towards-the-confluence-license-298978076.html] which uses SQL queries to get a count of active users which do take up a seat. However, as stated on the KB, a major caveat is that nested groups will not be counted correctly due to the recursive manner in which user/group/membership objects are stored in the database. It is not uncommon for accounts using an unlimited license to also have nested groups (i.e. configured in LDAP).

h2. Older tickets on this topic
The following were closed years ago due to various reasons but none of them address the caveats outlined above. Given the age of these tickets I've opted to open a new request instead of reopening an old one, as some of the comments/attachments contained are now obsolete.
* CONFSERVER-11205
* CONFSERVER-26410
* CONFSERVER-17575
fields.summary: Show a count of active users/seats taken in the UI for Unlimited license type

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Confluence currently doesn't have unique ID for the content entries. Items in the database already have ids in form of an incrementing integer. Unfortunately these IDs are only unique within the database itself, but change when importing/exporting content to another instance.

h3. Suggested Solution
Introduce universally unique identifier (UUID) which will be unique to every entry and persists when importing/exporting content to another instance.

h3. Why this is important
* Add-ons developers can use this as the persistence unique reference to exact object
* It will allow uniquely identify the attachments with the different titles in different spaces even if the space key has been changed
fields.summary: Introduce UUID for the content entries in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently our default {{server.xml}} has inconsistent entries for http and https entries. They should be the same, and also remove values that are not defined, e.g. {{debug="0"}}.
h3. Environment
 * tomcat 8

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Normal start up of confluence with default {{server.xml}}
h3. Expected Results

http and https perform the same, and there are no errors in the logs.
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the catalina.out file because of the {{debug="0"}} setting:
{noformat}
05-Jan-2017 18:01:12.174 WARNING [main] org.apache.tomcat.util.digester.SetPropertiesRule.begin [SetPropertiesRule]{Server} Setting property 'debug' to '0' did not find a matching property.
05-Jan-2017 18:01:12.346 WARNING [main] org.apache.catalina.startup.SetAllPropertiesRule.begin [SetAllPropertiesRule]{Server/Service/Connector} Setting property 'debug' to '0' did not find a matching property.
05-Jan-2017 18:01:12.393 WARNING [main] org.apache.tomcat.util.digester.SetPropertiesRule.begin [SetPropertiesRule]{Server/Service/Engine} Setting property 'debug' to '0' did not find a matching property.
05-Jan-2017 18:01:12.409 WARNING [main] org.apache.tomcat.util.digester.SetPropertiesRule.begin [SetPropertiesRule]{Server/Service/Engine/Host} Setting property 'debug' to '0' did not find a matching property.
05-Jan-2017 18:01:12.518 WARNING [main] org.apache.tomcat.util.digester.SetPropertiesRule.begin [SetPropertiesRule]{Server/Service/Engine/Host/Context} Setting property 'debug' to '0' did not find a matching property.
{noformat}
h3. Notes

Currently we have our optimised http entry
{code:xml}
        <Connector port="8090" connectionTimeout="20000" redirectPort="8443"
                maxThreads="48" minSpareThreads="10"
                enableLookups="false" acceptCount="10" debug="0" URIEncoding="UTF-8"
                protocol="org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11NioProtocol" />
{code}
However, the https entry is still the old, un-optimised version.
{code:xml}
        <Connector port="8443" maxHttpHeaderSize="8192"
                   maxThreads="150" minSpareThreads="25"
                   protocol="org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11NioProtocol"
                   enableLookups="false" disableUploadTimeout="true"
                   acceptCount="100" scheme="https" secure="true"
                   clientAuth="false" sslProtocols="TLSv1,TLSv1.1,TLSv1.2" sslEnabledProtocols="TLSv1,TLSv1.1,TLSv1.2" SSLEnabled="true"
                   URIEncoding="UTF-8" keystorePass="<MY_CERTIFICATE_PASSWORD>"/>
{code}
It should have, at a minimum
 * {{maxThreads="48" minSpareThreads="10"}}
 * {{acceptCount="10"}} (100 is the default)

h3. Workaround

Manually edit the file after installation
fields.summary: Update server.xml http and https to be consistent

fields.description:
h3 summary Permissionhelper didn't send right results for user who should be able to change permissions h3.Environment Confluence 6.1.3 h3. Steps to reproduce 1. Create a group in Active Directory named "app-confluence-space-keyuser", and add some users i.e "test" 2. Create a group in Active Directory named "app-confluence-space-user", and add some users 3. Permit each group with the right configuration:app-confluence-space-user can't set/change permissions and "app-confluence-space-keyuser" can set/change permissions 4. It's important that a user in "app-confluence-space-keyuser" and doublecheck this group has permissions to change rights Permission Helper is used #set($containerManagerClass = $content.class.forName('com.atlassian.spring.container.ContainerManager')) #set($getInstanceMethod = $containerManagerClass.getDeclaredMethod('getInstance',null)) #set($containerManager = $getInstanceMethod.invoke(null,null)) #set($containerContext = $containerManager.containerContext) #set($users = $userAccessor.getUsers()) #set($spaces = $spaceManager.getAllSpaces()) #foreach($spacer in $spaces) #if ($spacer.key == $space.key) #foreach($user in $users) #if ($permissionHelper.canSetPermissions($user, $spacer) and not $permissionHelper.isConfluenceAdministrator($user)) #else #end #end #end #end
KeyUser
#usernameLink($user.name)
h3. Expected result User has rights to change permissions User has no rights to administrate You can see the macro output, that the function $permissionHelper.canSetPermission output "false", but in the configuration you can see it is set true. h3. Actual Results permissionhelper didn't send right results for user "test"
fields.summary: PermissionHelper is sending incorrect data

fields.description:
Enterprise customers using [Red Hat OpenShift and Kubernetes|https://www.redhat.com/en/technologies/cloud-computing/openshift] want the ability to dockerize Confluence Data Center nodes for quick and easy deployment. This would also benefit client running Confluence Data Center in AWS that wish to automate deployment (outside of using the [AWS quick-start CloudFormation templates|https://www.atlassian.com/enterprise/data-center/aws]) and thus need to define static IP's in the confluence.cfg.xml config.

Due to the way this cloud works and/or security restrictions, they need the ability to use the [Hazelcast SPI discovery|http://docs.hazelcast.org/docs/3.8/manual/html-single/index.html#discovery-spi] instead of Multicast or Unicast. 

[Hazelcast 3.6+|http://docs.hazelcast.org/docs/3.6-EA/javadoc/com/hazelcast/spi/discovery/package-summary.html] is required to do this, but 3.8+ is preferred. Currently we use the following versions:
* Confluence 5.10.8 uses Hazelcast 3.4.2
* Confluence 6.0 through 6.6.5 uses Hazelcast 3.5.2
* Confluence 6.6.6+ uses Hazelcast 3.8.6: CONFSERVER-55867

(i) Updated the above two lines to reflect changes in 6.6.x - Note that while Hazelcast was upgraded, this does not necessarily mean SPI is supported in Confluence yet. 

Upgrading hazelcast to 3.8 would allow enterprise admins to more easily deploy Confluence Data Center nodes on the fly.
fields.summary: Include the ability to utilize Hazelcast's SPI discovery in Confluence Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When the user is trying to move the page tree with the restrictions applied the dialog warns only about the restrictions applied to the parent page but not for the children.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create two space
# Give the user space permission to set restrictions on the pages within first space.
# Don't give/Remove space permission to set restrictions on the pages within second space.
# Ask the user to move page with children from first to second space

h3. Expected Results
* The user is getting warning {{You can not restrict pages in the destination space. Remove restrictions before moving page}} when the restrictions applied for the parent page.
* The user is getting warning {{You can not restrict pages in the destination space. Remove restrictions before moving page}} when the restrictions only applied for any of child pages.
h3. Actual Results
* The user is getting warning {{You can not restrict pages in the destination space. Remove restrictions before moving page}} when the restrictions applied for the parent page.
* The user is getting no warning if the restrictions applied only to child pages


h3.Workaround
No workaround is currently available.
fields.summary: Restrictions for child pages are not checked while moving parent page

 # Create a new Question with the title, "Test ąćęłńóśźż".  In this example the characters are Polish.

h3. Expected Results

You are able to open the link and answer the Question within Confluence.
h3. Actual Results

Instead, the browser throws an error such as the below:
{code:java}

fields.description:
Confluence did not check if a user had permission to view a page when creating a workbox notification about new comments. An attacker who can login to Confluence could receive workbox notifications, which contain the content of comments, for comments added to a page after they started watching it even if they do not have permission to view the page itself.

*Affected versions:*
 * Versions of Confluence starting with 4.3.0 before 6.2.1 are affected by this vulnerability.

*Fix:*
 * *Confluence* Server 6.2.1 is available to download from [https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/download].

 *Workaround*

If you are unable to upgrade to the fixed version or newer and need a workaround, you will need to disable in-app notifications from workbox as per the instructions [found here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/configuring-workbox-notifications-301663830.html]:
 # Navigate to  !https://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/590259974/Cog.png! > *General Configuration*
 # Choose In-app Notifications in the left-hand panel
 # Select *does not provide in-app notifications*.
 # The workbox icon  !https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf61/files/877187111/877187147/1/1489126934141/WorkboxIcon.png! will disappear from the Confluence top menu bar.
  

*Acknowledgements*
Atlassian would like to credit Mathias Frank of SEC Consult Vulnerability Lab for reporting this issue to us.
fields.summary: Access Restriction Bypass using watch notifications (CVE-2017-9505)

fields.description:
h3. Summary According to https://docs.atlassian.com/confluence/REST/5.6/#d3e789, you can *limit* the response of rest calls with the *limit* parameter. However, this parameter is not working as the rest call will return the default value: *25*. You can also set a *start*, but apparently, it will use it's default value too, which is *0*. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create more than 30 child pages. You can use the following cURL command: {code} for ((i=1;i<=30;i++)) ; do curl -v -u admin:admin -X POST -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -H 'Accept: application/json' -d'{"type":"page","ancestors":[{"type":"page","id":}],"title":'$i',"space":{"key":""},"body":{"storage":{"value":"

This is a new page

","representation":"storage"}}}' "/rest/api/content/?os_authType=basic"; done {code} (i) Replace the *< >* tags. # Use the following URL: {code} /rest/api/content//child?expand=page&start=5&limit=10 {code} h3. Expected Results Confluence will show only 10 results, starting from the 5th entry. h3. Actual Results Rest API will show 25 results starting from the 1st entry and no more. If you want to show 30 results(&limit=30) instead, it will still display just 25. h3.Workaround No workarounds
fields.summary: REST API "limit" and "start" not working for ContentChild endpoint

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Chrome 58 and later releases require subjectAlternativeName (SAN) extension as per [https://developers.google.com/web/updates/2017/03/chrome-58-deprecations#remove_support_for_commonname_matching_in_certificates]

Please see related links on the changes
 * [https://www.thesslstore.com/blog/security-changes-in-chrome-58/]
 * [https://communities.ca.com/thread/241776307]

h3. Suggested Solution
Update the documentation at [https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/running-confluence-over-ssl-or-https-161203.html] to share steps on
* How to generate certificate with subjectAlternativeName extension using [Keystore Explorer|http://keystore-explorer.org/index.html]. We are already suggesting to use Keystore Explorer, but it would be good to have more details on that
** Portecle doesn't seem to support adding subjectAlternativeName on creation
* How to generate certificate with subjectAlternativeName extension via Command line
** Reference; [http://stackoverflow.com/questions/33827789/self-signed-certificate-dnsname-components-must-begin-with-a-letter]

h3. Why this is important
Chrome will throw an error on certificate generated without subjectAlternativeName extension. Other browsers will soon follow

Summary In case of multiple JIRA Issues marcos on the page created with markup (still acceptable approach according to [the documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/jira-issues-macro-139380.html] all the Jira Issus macros will use the JQL from first (higest on the page) JIRA Issue macro. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a new page # Insert > Markup > Confluence Wiki # Create JIRA Issue Macro markup with some JQL: {code}{jiraissues:url=http://jira.server:8080/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-xml/temp/SearchRequest.xml?jqlQuery=project = KAN AND resolution = Unresolved ORDER BY priority DESC, updated DESC }{code} # Insert > Markup > Confluence Wiki # Create JIRA Issue Macro markup with other JQL: {code}{jiraissues:url=http://jira.server:8080/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-xml/temp/SearchRequest.xml?jqlQuery=project = PM AND resolution = Unresolved ORDER BY priority DESC, updated DESC}{code} # Save/Publish the page h3. Expected Results Two different JIRA Issues macros created: !Screen Shot 2017-06-07 at 16.40.35.png|thumbnail! h3. Actual Results Two JIRA Issues macros created with the content of the first one: !Screen Shot 2017-06-07 at 16.43.11.png|thumbnail! h3. Notes The page with JIRA issues macros created with markup has the following storage fromat : {code}

First JQL

Second JQL

{code} While the page with JIRA Issues Macros created from Macros browser has following storage format: {code}

First JQL

Your Company JIRA key,summary,type,created,updated,due,assignee,reporter,priority,status,resolution 20 project = KAN AND resolution = Unresolved ORDER BY priority DESC, updated DESC fce51a65-222d-3338-927c-21fbb2bf7b90

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Customize meeting notes index space and global blueprint template. Then revert back space blueprint template to default, newly created space meeting notes index will not get styling from Global template.

h3. Environment
Confluence 6.1.3.
Collaborative editing on.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# create space "Test A"
# create any page from template (to install template&blueprints on a fresh install)
# modify global blueprint for "Meeting notes index"
# create page "meeting note" in "Test A"
# Meeting Notes Index shows modification of "step 3".
# modify Space blueprint for "Meeting notes index"
# delete Meeting Notes Index in "Test A"
# create page "meeting note 2" in "Test A"
# Meeting Notes Index shows modification of "step 6".
# restore Space blueprint for "Meeting notes index" to default
# modify global blueprint for "Meeting notes index"
# delete Meeting Notes Index in "Test A"
# create page "meeting note 3" in "Test A"
## Space blueprint for "Meeting notes index" show modification of step 11
## Meeting Notes Index shows default meeting notes index of fresh install
## expected result was: it should have shown modification of step 11

More information in fallowing video.  [^blueprints_bug.mp4.zip] 


h3. Expected Results
Reseting space template should revert to global template.

h3. Actual Results
Template is reseted for all new meeting notes as if the both (global and space templates are rested).

h3.Workaround
When open space template and you see global styles, press save and not cancel. That way you will save global styles to space template.
fields.summary: Customizing Meeting notes index Space Blueprints and reverting the template to default will not revert to Global Meeting Index Blueprint template.

fields.description:
I have set up a page using nested LocalTabs to help organize all the tabs in the page into groups of tabs. I am trying to create a "table of contents" but am not able to link to any of the tabs despite giving each one a Tab ID.

This issue was reported as a bug in the following issue, but was closed because the Navitabs macro does not support this behavior. I am requesting that it be updated to support this behavior.

[https://bitvoodoo.atlassian.net/browse/NAVITABS-59]
fields.summary: Add support for linking any tab ID on a page

fields.description:
h3. Summary

External gadgets won't be found in the Macro Browser due to errors from the *MacroMetadataProvider*. You also won't be able to insert them manually, as the summary of the macro won't appear as the following screenshots:

 

*Working gadget:*

!working.png|thumbnail!

*Not working:*

!not_working.png|thumbnail!
h3. Environment
 * Confluence 6.2.0(with and without proxy)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup Confluence and JIRA with SSL(selfsigned certificate).
 # Add a gadget feed in Confluence.
 # Stop both services and revert the changes(remove the SSL).
 # Remove the existing gadget feed(with HTTTPS url).
 # Add a new gadget feed(with HTTP url)
or

 # Install Copy Page Tree add-on( v2.5.0, v2.5.2 or v2.5.3)

h3. Expected Results

External Gadgets will be found in the macro browser and you will be able to insert them.
h3. Actual Results

Macros are not found and manually inserting the gadget doesn't work. Logs will show:
{code:java}
2017-06-06 17:10:15,693 ERROR [http-nio-8090-exec-4] [confluence.macro.browser.DefaultMacroMetadataManager] buildMacroSummaries Error getting summaries from MacroMetadataProvider,
– referer: [http://localhost:8090/confluence/display/BLAN/teste+2] | url: /confluence/plugins/macrobrowser/browse-macros.action | traceId: 5185927b4b60903a | userName: admin | action: browse-macros
java.lang.NullPointerException
at com.atlassian.confluence.cache.ehcache.EhCacheManager.wrapCache(EhCacheManager.java:151)
at com.atlassian.confluence.cache.ehcache.EhCacheManager.getCache(EhCacheManager.java:160)
at com.atlassian.confluence.cache.ehcache.EhCacheManager.getCaches(EhCacheManager.java:141)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
{code}
h3. Notes
 - Flushing the cache won't fix.
 - Clear the plugins cache won't fix.
 - Restart both instances won't fix.
 - No errors besides the above one in the logs.

h3. Workaround

In case you have the Copy Page Tree add-on installed( v2.5.0, v2.5.2 or v2.5.3), *uninstall* it or downgrade it.
fields.summary: External Gadgets not working due to error with MacroMetadataProvider

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When setting up Confluence Data Center with AWS Cloudformation over SSL. Confluence is using the wrong {{reza.service.url}} to connect to Synchrony. 
Confluence is connecting using the following URL 
{code:borderStyle=solid}
https://www.example.com/synchrony/v1
{code}
while Synchrony is expecting
{code:borderStyle=solid}
https://www.example.com/synchrony
{code}


h3. Environment
* AWS Cloudformation template
* HTTPS environment


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Start Confluence Data Center from AWS Cloudformation Template
# Make sure to have an SSL certificate
# Enter the *SSL Certificate Name* during the wizard
# Start the Cluster


h3. Expected Results
Confluence will be able to successfully connect to Synchrony


h3. Actual Results
Collaborative editing will show as connected, but when editing or creating a page. That page will not be able to be saved because Confluence cannot communicate with Synchrony. 
Synchrony logs will show the following error
{code:borderStyle=solid}
"synchrony":{  
      "entity":"Synchrony-6f71d906-e8de-33b6-9b90-28a49b679150",
      "type":"jwt/invalid-aud",
      "aud":"https://www.example.com/synchrony/v1",
      "expected-auds":[  
         "https://www.example.com/synchrony"
      ],
      "ns":"synchrony.sync.hub",
      "level":"warn",
      "throwable":"clojure.lang.ExceptionInfo: JWT aud property does not match expected value {:type :jwt/invalid-aud, :aud \"https://confluence-dev.exascaleproject.org/synchrony/v1\", :expected-auds [\"https://confluence-dev.exascaleproject.org/synchrony/v1\"], :entity \"Synchrony-6f71d906-e8de-33b6-9b90-28a49b679150\"}\n\tat clojure.core$ex_info.invoke(core.clj:4593)\n\tat synchrony.auth$parse_verify$fn__39538$state_machine__4460__auto____39539$fn__39541.invoke(auth.clj:39)\n\tat synchrony.auth$parse_verify$fn__39538$state_machine__4460__auto____39539.invoke(auth.clj:28)\n\tat synchrony.auth$parse_verify$fn__39538.invoke(auth.clj:28)\n\tat ginga.async.take?(async.cljx:0)\n\tat synchrony.sync.hub$accept$fn__43513$state_machine__4460__auto____43514$fn__43516.invoke(hub.clj:775)\n\tat synchrony.sync.hub$accept$fn__43513$state_machine__4460__auto____43514.invoke(hub.clj:775)\n\tat clojure.core.async.impl.ioc_macros$run_state_machine.invoke(ioc_macros.clj:1012)\n\tat clojure.core.async.impl.ioc_macros$run_state_machine_wrapped.invoke(ioc_macros.clj:1016)\n\tat clojure.core.async.impl.ioc_macros$take_BANG_$fn__4476.invoke(ioc_macros.clj:1025)\n\tat clojure.core.async.impl.channels.ManyToManyChannel$fn__313$fn__314.invoke(channels.clj:95)\n\tat clojure.lang.AFn.run(AFn.java:22)\n\tat java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)\n\tat java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)\n\tat java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)\n",
      "message":"synchrony.sync.hub [warn] JWT aud property does not match expected value"
{code}

 

h3.Workaround
The only workaround at the moment, is to modify the reza service url manually, but *note that this will break the autoscaling group. You will need to do those modifications manually with every Synchrony node started. Moreover, you will loose those changes when you scale down any existing Synchrony node*
# Open {{/etc/init.d/atl-init-synchrony.sh}}
# Changed the value of this attribute to the following:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
-Dreza.service.url=https://www.example.com/synchrony
{code}
# Save
# Reboot Synchrony Node

Confluence should now be able to save any page edits and changes.
fields.summary: Synchrony Node on AWS Cloudformation is taking the wrong HTTPS Service URL

fields.description:
The retry logic assumes that all subsequent queries to a URL are valid if the first query succeeds. Since the JS files are cached, the URL is still considered as "working" even if it has been removed from the reverse proxy's configuration. If the editor makes requests to get dynamic content from Synchrony later on, it will fail.

*Workaround:*
# Reload of the page forcefully 
# Clear the browser cache.

Although this case is rare, we will need to do the following corrective actions:
# Update the documentation or add a new KB so that the user knows how to workaround it.
# Update the code to use the heartbeat query (without caching its results). If the heartbeat response is OK, the we will append the scripts to the header of the page.
fields.summary: If the configuration in the reverse proxy is changed and the JS files are cached, the editor fails to try the fallback URL because it thinks the first URL is still working

fields.description:
+Situation+:

On a space where a user has rights to delete pages, there is a notification that the page has been moved to the trash when using the delete button.

 

+Problem+:
There is no access to the trash for restoring the page (asymetric behavior).

 

+Invalid workaround+:
If the user is granted "Space - Admin", the Trash tab is available but it includes also the trash purge option (too much for a contributor).

 

+Gap to address+:
It would be useful that the rights allowing a page to be deleted to also allow access to the Trash section only for restore (or any other way to restore deleted page).
fields.summary: As a space contributor, I should be able to restore what I delete
